meanings.definition: The ability of a material to perform with an appropriate host response in a specific application.
meanings.sent1: The biocompatibility of the new implant was crucial for its success in the patient's body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors carefully consider the biocompatibility of materials used in medical devices to ensure patient safety.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that the alien material had perfect biocompatibility with Earth organisms.
meanings.sent4: The biocompatibility of the synthetic skin was so remarkable that it seamlessly integrated with the natural tissue.
meanings.sent5: The biocompatibility test results clearly showed the compatibility of the material with living organisms.

meanings.definition: The quality of not having toxic or injurious effects on biological systems.
meanings.sent1: The biocompatibility of the new medication was confirmed through extensive testing.
meanings.sent2: The biocompatibility of the plant extract made it a safe ingredient for skincare products.
meanings.sent3: The chef proudly claimed that his dishes had perfect biocompatibility with his customers' taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The biocompatibility of the cleaning solution ensured it wouldn't harm the environment.
meanings.sent5: The biocompatibility of the organic fertilizer promoted healthy growth in the garden.
